actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Committee on Governmental Affairs received executive comment from GAO.

official_title: A bill to provide for the disposition of unclaimed property in the custody of the United States.

summary.text: Unclaimed Property Act of 1985 - Directs the Comptroller General to examine Federal agency records annually for unclaimed property. Requires agencies to transfer all unclaimed property to the Administrator of General Services for disposition. Directs the Comptroller General to report annually, beginning June 30, 1987, to an authorized State officer (upon the request of such officer) all relevant information concerning unclaimed property in which the State may be interested if: (1) such State certifies that it is a lawful custodian and entitled to the unclaimed property; and (2) the Comptroller General is satisfied that the United States is protected against any claim if the State escheats or acquires lawful custody of such property. Sets forth procedures for the recovery of unclaimed property by States. Authorizes appropriations as necessary to the Comptroller General and the General Services Administration to carry out this Act. Makes conforming amendments to the Federal Property and Administration Services Act of 1949 and certain provisions of military law concerning the disposition of unclaimed property.

titles.title: A bill to provide for the disposition of unclaimed property in the custody of the United States.
